verses.verse: And Samson<WH8123> went down<WH3381> to Timnath,<WH8553> and saw<WH7200> a woman<WH802> in Timnath<WH8553> of the daughters<WH4480> <WH1323> of the Philistines.<WH6430>

And he came up,<WH5927> and told<WH5046> his father<WH1> and his mother,<WH517> and said,<WH559> I have seen<WH7200> a woman<WH802> in Timnath<WH8553> of the daughters<WH4480> <WH1323> of the Philistines:<WH6430> now<WH6258> therefore get<WH3947> her for me to wife.<WH802>

Then his father<WH1> and his mother<WH517> said<WH559> unto him, Is there never<WH369> a woman<WH802> among the daughters<WH1323> of thy brethren,<WH251> or among all<WH3605> my people,<WH5971> that<WH3588> thou<WH859> goest<WH1980> to take<WH3947> a wife<WH802> of the uncircumcised<WH6189> Philistines?<WH4480> <WH6430> And Samson<WH8123> said<WH559> unto<WH413> his father,<WH1> Get<WH3947> her for me; for<WH3588> she<WH1931> pleaseth me well.<WH3474> <WH5869>

But his father<WH1> and his mother<WH517> knew<WH3045> not<WH3808> that<WH3588> it<WH1931> was of the LORD,<WH4480> <WH3068> that<WH3588> he<WH1931> sought<WH1245> an occasion<WH8385> against the Philistines:<WH4480> <WH6430> for at that<WH1931> time<WH6256> the Philistines<WH6430> had dominion<WH4910> over Israel.<WH3478>

Then went Samson down,<WH3381> <WH8123> and his father<WH1> and his mother,<WH517> to Timnath,<WH8553> and came<WH935> to<WH5704> the vineyards<WH3754> of Timnath:<WH8553> and, behold,<WH2009> a young<WH3715> lion<WH738> roared<WH7580> against<WH7125> him.

And the Spirit<WH7307> of the LORD<WH3068> came mightily<WH6743> upon<WH5921> him, and he rent<WH8156> him as he would have rent<WH8156> a kid,<WH1423> and he had nothing<WH3972> <WH369> in his hand:<WH3027> but he told<WH5046> not<WH3808> his father<WH1> or his mother<WH517> <WH853> what<WH834> he had done.<WH6213>
And he went down,<WH3381> and talked<WH1696> with the woman;<WH802> and she pleased Samson well.<WH3474> <WH5869> <WH8123>

And after a time<WH4480> <WH3117> he returned<WH7725> to take<WH3947> her, and he turned aside<WH5493> to see<WH7200> <WH853> the carcass<WH4658> of the lion:<WH738> and, behold,<WH2009> there was a swarm<WH5712> of bees<WH1682> and honey<WH1706> in the carcass<WH1472> of the lion.<WH738>

And he took<WH7287> thereof in<WH413> his hands,<WH3709> and went on<WH1980> <WH1980> eating,<WH398> and came<WH1980> to<WH413> his father<WH1> and mother,<WH517> and he gave<WH5414> them, and they did eat:<WH398> but he told<WH5046> not<WH3808> them that<WH3588> he had taken<WH7287> the honey<WH1706> out of the carcass<WH4480> <WH1472> of the lion.<WH738>
So his father<WH1> went down<WH3381> unto<WH413> the woman:<WH802> and Samson<WH8123> made<WH6213> there<WH8033> a feast;<WH4960> for<WH3588> so<WH3651> used the young men<WH970> to do.<WH6213>
And it came to pass,<WH1961> when they saw<WH7200> him, that they brought<WH3947> thirty<WH7970> companions<WH4828> to be<WH1961> with<WH854> him.

And Samson<WH8123> said<WH559> unto them, I will now<WH4994> put forth<WH2330> a riddle<WH2420> unto you: if<WH518> ye can certainly declare<WH5046> <WH5046> it me within the seven<WH7651> days<WH3117> of the feast,<WH4960> and find it out,<WH4672> then I will give<WH5414> you thirty<WH7970> sheets<WH5466> and thirty<WH7970> change<WH2487> of garments: <WH899>

But if<WH518> ye cannot<WH3201> <WH3808> declare<WH5046> it me, then shall ye<WH859> give<WH5414> me thirty<WH7970> sheets<WH5466> and thirty<WH7970> change<WH2487> of garments.<WH899> And they said<WH559> unto him, Put forth<WH2330> thy riddle,<WH2420> that we may hear<WH8085> it.

And he said<WH559> unto them, Out of the eater<WH4480> <WH398> came forth<WH3318> meat,<WH3978> and out of the strong<WH4480> <WH5794> came forth<WH3318> sweetness.<WH4966> And they could<WH3201> not<WH3808> in three<WH7969> days<WH3117> expound<WH5046> the riddle.<WH2420>

And it came to pass<WH1961> on the seventh<WH7637> day,<WH3117> that they said<WH559> unto Samson's<WH8123> wife,<WH802> Entice<WH6601> <WH853> thy husband,<WH376> that he may declare<WH5046> unto us<WH853> the riddle,<WH2420> lest<WH6435> we burn<WH8313> thee and thy father's<WH1> house<WH1004> with fire:<WH784> have ye called<WH7121> us to take that we have?<WH3423> is it not<WH3808> so?

And Samson's<WH8123> wife<WH802> wept<WH1058> before<WH5921> him, and said,<WH559> Thou dost but<WH7535> hate<WH8130> me, and lovest<WH157> me not:<WH3808> thou hast put forth<WH2330> a riddle<WH2420> unto the children<WH1121> of my people,<WH5971> and hast not<WH3808> told<WH5046> it me. And he said<WH559> unto her, Behold,<WH2009> I have not<WH3808> told<WH5046> it my father<WH1> nor my mother,<WH517> and shall I tell<WH5046> it thee?

And she wept<WH1058> before<WH5921> him the seven<WH7651> days,<WH3117> while<WH834> their feast<WH4960> lasted:<WH1961> and it came to pass<WH1961> on the seventh<WH7637> day,<WH3117> that he told<WH5046> her, because<WH3588> she lay sore<WH6693> upon him: and she told<WH5046> the riddle<WH2420> to the children<WH1121> of her people.<WH5971>

And the men<WH376> of the city<WH5892> said<WH559> unto him on the seventh<WH7637> day<WH3117> before<WH2962> the sun<WH2775> went down,<WH935> What<WH4100> is sweeter<WH4966> than honey?<WH4480> <WH1706> and what<WH4100> is stronger<WH5794> than a lion?<WH4480> <WH738> And he said<WH559> unto them, If<WH3884> ye had not plowed<WH2790> with my heifer,<WH5697> ye had not<WH3808> found out<WH4672> my riddle.<WH2420>

And the Spirit<WH7307> of the LORD<WH3068> came<WH6743> upon<WH5921> him, and he went down<WH3381> to Ashkelon,<WH831> and slew<WH5221> thirty<WH7970> men<WH376> of<WH4480> them, and took<WH3947> <WH853> their spoil,<WH2488> and gave<WH5414> change of garments<WH2487> unto them which expounded<WH5046> the riddle.<WH2420> And his anger<WH639> was kindled,<WH2734> and he went up<WH5927> to his father's<WH1> house.<WH1004>
But Samson's<WH8123> wife<WH802> was<WH1961> given to his companion,<WH4828> whom<WH834> he had used as his friend.<WH7462>
